Trump and Putin: A toxic and opaque relationship
subhead: For nearly 20 years, the US president has shown a clear fascination with his Russian counterpart, whom he is set to meet at a summit on Ukraine this Friday in Alaska. His real estate empire has benefited greatly from Russian private capital.

title: Israeli far right seeks to approve settlement project that would split West Bank in two
subhead: Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich, who has advocated for the construction of 3,000 housing units in the E1 settlement, said it would 'bury' the possibility of a Palestinian state.

title: Negotiators fail to strike international treaty on plastic pollution
subhead: After 10 days of intense negotiations at the UN in Geneva, Switzerland, delegates from 185 nations could not find common ground on how to tackle plastic pollution. Some countries said they were prepared for future negotiations, despite six rounds of failed talks over three years.

title: Charlotte Perriand's family's relentless mission to keep her legacy alive
subhead: Since the death of architect and designer Charlotte Perriand in 1999, her legacy has been in the devoted hands of her daughter and son-in-law. Their meticulous work has played a significant role in elevating the prolific 'Charlotte' to the rank of design icon.

title: Trauma lingers in Greece, 10 years after austerity referendum
subhead: A decade after Greece rejected a third austerity package from its creditors, the economy has improved, but much of the population continues to struggle.

title: Piracy evolves to target porn actresses, left powerless by leaks
subhead: 'Click to Pirate' (3/5). Pirates siphon off content from professional erotic or pornographic performers to distribute it for free. This phenomenon sometimes also involves the circulation of non-consensual videos.

title: 'Who shot JR?': The 'Dallas' episode that had the whole world on edge
subhead: 'Breaking The Script' (1/6). These legendary TV episodes shaped and transformed the genre. In 1980, at the end of the third season of 'Dallas,' the infamous JR Ewing was gunned down outside his office door. For eight long months, suspense over the shooter's identity kept viewers hooked. Spoiler alert!
